**Current English**: "Welcome to %{exercise_title} on Exercism's %{track_title} Track."
exercises.documents.submitting_solution:
**Functional Purpose**: Informational content providing context or instructions

**UI Location**: Located in the exercises/documents section

**When Users See This**: During normal use of the Exercism platform

**Technical Context**: Contains dynamic variables: %{solution_file_paths} - these must remain unchanged

**Translation Notes**: Keep 'Exercism' as the brand name - do not translate

**Current English**: "You can submit your solution using the `exercism submit %{solution_file_paths}` command.
This command will upload your solution to the Exercism website and print the solution page's URL.

It's possible to submit an incomplete solution which allows you to:

- See how others have completed the exercise
- Request help from a mentor"

notifications_mailer.eligible_for_lifeti:
**Functional Purpose**: Emphatic statement or call-to-action

**UI Location**: Located in the notifications mailer/eligible for lifetime insiders section

**When Users See This**: During normal use of the Exercism platform

**Technical Context**: Contains dynamic variables: %{insiders_url} - these must remain unchanged

**Current English**: "Hey!

I'm excited to let you know you're eligible for Exercism Insiders – our rewards program for people who contribute, mentor, or donate to Exercism.  
You can activate your Insiders account on the [Insiders Page](%{insiders_url}).

Insiders gives you a few extra benefits:

- Access to our sexy Dark Mode
- ChatGPT Integration for when you get stuck on exercises
- Behind the scenes content. You can watch videos from me and the team, keeping you in the loop, as we work on Exercism.
- Closer access to the team and key community members, with our dedicated #insiders Discord channel.
- Extra mentoring slots.
- Exclusive Badges
- And more!

We've granted you **Lifetime** status, which means you'll always have access to Insiders.  
The [Insiders Page](%{insiders_url}) contains lots more detail, or watch the video below to learn more 👇

<a href="

**Current English**: "Hey there,

Did you know that **we're a not-for-profit organisation?**

notifications_mailer.onboarding_communit:
**Functional Purpose**: Emphatic statement or call-to-action

**UI Location**: Located in the notifications mailer/onboarding community section

**When Users See This**: As a greeting or welcome message

**Technical Context**: Contains dynamic variables: %{youtube_video_url}, %{youtube_thumbnail_url}, %{root_url} - these must remain unchanged

**Translation Notes**: Keep 'Exercism' as the brand name - do not translate. Keep programming terminology unchanged: Git, GitHub

**Current English**: "Hello there!

I hope you're enjoying your first few days on [Exercism](https://exercism.org).  
As you continue to explore our platform, I wanted to take a moment to tell you about our amazing community.

Exercism is an open-source, community-powered project.  
In fact, we're one of the biggest open-source organisations on [GitHub](https://github.com/exercism/) with over 350 repositories.  
Our community is centered around our values of empathy, kindness, and inclusivity.  
Check out this video or read more below 👇

<a href="
**Functional Purpose**: Question or prompt asking for user input or decision

**UI Location**: Located in the notifications mailer/onboarding product section

**When Users See This**: When the system needs user input or decision

**Technical Context**: Contains dynamic variables: %{root_url} - these must remain unchanged

**Translation Notes**: Keep 'Exercism' as the brand name - do not translate. Keep programming terminology unchanged: Python, JavaScript

**Current English**: "Hey there,

It's been a day or so since you signed up to [Exercism](https://exercism.org), and I wanted to check how you're getting on so far?

Sometimes Exercism can be a bit overwhelming at first. Some people get a bit lost and things don't quite make sense to them.  
If you get stuck, check out our [Discord](https://exercism.org/r/discord) or [Forum](https://exercism.org/r/forum), where you can ask for help.  
It's always helpful for us to know where people are tripping up so we can fix it, so please don't be afraid to speak up!

If you've not started exploring a language yet, we have over 65 to choose from, including the most widely used languages (e.g. Python, JavaScript, C#), the popular new-kids on the block (e.g. Go, Elixir, Rust) and some quite unusual and esoteric languages (e.g. 8th, COBOL, Prolog).  
There's tons to learn and a lot of fun to be had!

And as a final reminder, Exercism is 100% free, open-source and not for profit. Enjoy!

Best regards,  

Jeremy Walker  
Exercism Co-founder & CEO

[Visit Exercism](%{root_url})"

notifications_mailer.eligible_for_inside:

**Current English**: "Hey!

I'm excited to let you know you're eligible for Exercism Insiders - our rewards program for people who contribute, mentor, or donate to Exercism.

Insiders gives you three main benefits:

Jeremy Walker

**Current English**: "Hi %{user_handle},

You've completed a few exercises (nice work!) but not yet requested mentoring on any of your solutions.

Receiving feedback from our mentors is an amazing way of discovering your knowledge gaps and levelling up your skills. It's one of Exercism's most valuable features, and like all of Exercism, it's absolutely free!

Choose a solution that you feel has the most room for improvement and request a mentor to take a look at it. They should get back to you within a day or so with some ideas!

[Choose a solution →](%{notification_url})
"
